pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:0.5: 52. The training rule on abusing monks
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying  in the hall with the peaked roof in the Great Wood near Vesālī,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.2: Venerable Upāli’s preceptor, Venerable Kappita, was staying in a charnel ground.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.3: At that time the leader of the nuns from the group of six had just died.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.4: They took her to that charnel ground, cremated her near Venerable Kappita’s dwelling, and made a stupa. They then went there to cry.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.5: Venerable Kappita was disturbed by the noise, and so he demolished the stupa and scattered the rubble.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.6: The nuns from the group of six thought,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.7: “Kappita has demolished our Venerable’s stupa; let’s kill him,” and they laid a plan.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.8: A certain nun told Venerable Upāli what was happening,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.9: and he in turn told Venerable Kappita.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.10: Venerable Kappita then left his dwelling and went into hiding.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.11: Soon afterwards the nuns from the group of six went to his dwelling
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.12: and crushed it with rocks and lumps of earth. When they thought he was dead, they left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.13: The following morning Venerable Kappita robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Vesālī for almsfood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.14: When the nuns from the group of six saw him,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.16: “Kappita is alive! Who spoiled our plan?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.20: “How could this barber, this dirt remover of inferior caste, spoil our plan?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.21: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.22: “How could the nuns from the group of six abuse Venerable Upāli?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.23: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.26: “How could the nuns from the group of six do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.28: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:1.29.1: ‘If a nun abuses or reviles a monk, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.8: if she abuses with the ten kinds of abuse or with any one of them, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.1.10: if she induces fear, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.1: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as such, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.2: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.3: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as such, and she abuses or reviles him, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.4: If she abuses or reviles someone who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.5: If he is not fully ordained, but she perceives him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.6: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.2.7: If he is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.2: if she is aiming at something beneficial;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.3: if she is aiming at giving a teaching;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.4: if she is aiming at giving an instruction;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc52:2.3.7: The second training rule is finished.
